intro: Nephrodium glaucostipes, commonly known as the blue-stemmed nephroid, is a rare fern native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue-green fronds and distinctive, clustered rhizomes. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that release spores for propagation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is often found in conservation programs.
